intro: Achillea cretica, commonly known as Cretan yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Achillea cretica is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
